concept.title: How to Install
concept.shortdesc: Build from source or use the ZIP or TAR distribution to install on every physical and virtual machine that will run .

ol.li: Set the JAVA_HOME environment variable. On Linux/Unix platforms: JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.8.0_60 export JAVA_HOME On Windows platforms:set JAVA_HOME=c:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_60
Download the project source from the Releases page found at http://geode.incubator.apache.org.

Within the incubator-geode directory, build on Linux/Unix platforms:$ ./gradlew build installDist -Dskip.tests=trueWithin the incubator-geode folder, build on Windows platforms:$ gradlew.bat build installDist -Dskip.tests=true

Verify the installation by invoking gfsh to print version information and exit. On Linux/Unix platforms:$ cd gemfire-assembly/build/install/apache-geode $ gfsh version v1.0.0-incubating-SNAPSHOTOn Windows platforms:$ cd gemfire-assembly\build\install\apache-geode $ gfsh version v1.0.0-incubating-SNAPSHOT
Download the .zip or .tar file from the Releases page found at http://geode.incubator.apache.org.
Unzip the .zip file or expand the .tar file. For the .zip format:$ unzip gemfire-1.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT.zip -d path_to_productFor the .tar format:$ tar -xvf gemfire-1.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT.tar -C path_to_product
Set the JAVA_HOME environment variable. On Linux/Unix platforms: JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.8.0_60 export JAVA_HOME On Windows platforms:set JAVA_HOME=c:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_60
Add the scripts to your PATH environment variable. On Linux/Unix platforms: PATH=$PATH:$JAVA_HOME/bin:path_to_product/bin export PATHOn Windows platforms:set PATH=%PATH%;%JAVA_HOME%\bin;%GEMFIRE%\bin

This following step only applies to environments where you are running processes or client applications outside of gfsh. The gfsh script sets these environment variables for you. If you are running processes or applications outside of gfsh, then configure the following two environment variables.
Set the GEMFIRE environment variable to point to your installation top-level directory. Directories bin, lib, and dtd will be within this top-level directory. On Linux/Unix platforms:GEMFIRE=path_to_product export GEMFIREFor Windows platforms:set GEMFIRE=C:\path_to_product
Set the GF_JAVA environment variables to point to the java executable relative to the JAVA_HOME environment variable. On Linux/Unix platforms: GF_JAVA=$JAVA_HOME/bin/java export GF_JAVA On Windows platforms: set GF_JAVA=%JAVA_HOME%\bin\java.exe

To verify the installation, type gfsh version at the command line and note that the output lists the installed version of . For example:$ gfsh version v1.0.0-incubating-SNAPSHOTIf you want more detailed version information such as the date of the build, build number and JDK version being used, type gfsh version --full.
